title: Compare P and T at points in containers

content.question: The figure above represents atoms of helium gas in two containers with the same volume. The gas in each container is at thermal equilibrium, and the root mean square speed of the atoms in the two containers is the same. The letters <math alttext="W" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> label points in the container, with <math alttext="W" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> near the edge and points <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="Z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at the center. Which of the following correctly compares the pressures and temperatures at the labeled points?

choices.label: PressuresTemperatures<math alttext="open parenthesis, P sub W equals P sub X, close parenthesis, is greater than, open parenthesis, P sub Y equals P sub Z, close parenthesis " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Z</mi></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="T sub W equals T sub X, which equals T sub Y, which equals T sub Z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Z</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

PressuresTemperatures<math alttext="open parenthesis, P sub W equals P sub X, close parenthesis, is greater than, open parenthesis, P sub Y equals P sub Z, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Z</mi></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="open parenthesis, T sub W equals T sub X, close parenthesis, is greater than, open parenthesis, T sub Y equals T sub Z, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Z</mi></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

PressuresTemperatures<math alttext="P sub W is greater than P sub X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="P sub Y is greater than P sub Z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Z</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="T sub W equals T sub X, which equals T sub Y, which equals T sub Z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Z</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

PressuresTemperatures<math alttext="P sub W is greater than P sub X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="P sub Y is greater than P sub Z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Z</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="open parenthesis, T sub W equals T sub X, close parenthesis, is greater than, open parenthesis, T sub Y equals T sub Z, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Z</mi></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: PressuresTemperatures<math alttext="open parenthesis, P sub W equals P sub X, close parenthesis, is greater than, open parenthesis, P sub Y equals P sub Z, close parenthesis " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Z</mi></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="T sub W equals T sub X, which equals T sub Y, which equals T sub Z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>X</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>Z</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 9.1: Kinetic Theory of Temperature and Pressure

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
